sourcesContent: import React from "react"; import { Fragment } from "react"; import Title from "./components/title"; import Card from "./components/card"; class Knowledge extends React.Component { render() { return ( <div className="card-group text-center"> <Card section="HTML" text="The standar HTML5 markup languaje. I have Medium-high level to be able to build a large number of web pages." /> <Card section="CSS" text="The graphic design language in cascading to define and create a web page." /> <Card section="Firebase" text="Only know how to use for deploying and RealTime database for web apps but my intention is to keep learning more." /> <Card section="JavaScript" text="This is one of my favorites. This language add the functionality to the web page. Requires logic and lateral think." /> <Card section="React" text="The JavaScript Framework created by Facebook. Im constantly learnig from this framework. i currently have a medium level on this one." /> </div> <div className="text-center container"> <h1 className="margin">Languages</h1> <div className="row"> <div className="col-md-3"></div> <div className="col-md-3 center"> <div className="center"> <Card section="Spanish" text="Native language. I Speak it since I was born." /> </div> </div> <div className="col-md-3 center"> <Card section="English" text="Secondary language, I know 60% and keep learning." /> </div> <div className="col-md-3"></div> </div> </div> </Fragment> ); } } export default Knowledge;
